availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mahlon Dickerson Manson (Montgomery County, Indiana, druggist, soldier and politician)

body.p: Montgomery County, Indiana, druggist, soldier and politician. Piqua, Miami County, Ohio native. Married to Caroline Manson. Father of Laura C. Manson, Mahlon F. Manson, William N. Manson, Sallie Manson, and Mattie Manson. Served in the 5th Indiana Volunteers as captain from 1847 to 1848. Druggist in Union, Indiana in 1850. Served in the Indiana state legislature from 1851 to 1852. Druggist in Crawfordsville in 1860. Served in the 10th Indiana Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain and colonel from May 1861. Served in the Union Army as brigadier general of volunteers from March 1862 to December 21, 1864. Unsuccessful Democratic Party candidate for lieutenant governor in Indiana in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Union, p. 435A.
